Pre-Game Insights: The New Orleans Pelicans are 4.5-point favorites as they try to break a 15-game road losing streak against the Washington Wizards on January 5, 2025.
The game will be held at Capital One Arena in Washington D.C. and will air at 6:00 PM ET on MNMT and Gulf Coast Sports.
New Orleans has 13 wins in 35 games against the spread this year, while Washington has beaten the spread 13 times in 32 games.
As a 4.5-point favorite or greater, the Pelicans have two wins ATS (2-2). Against the spread as 4.5-point underdogs or more, the Wizards are 12-19.
Pelicans games this season have gone over the total of 235.5 points 11 times, while the Wizards have played 13 games that finished with a combined score over 235.5 points.

New Orleans’ outings this year have an average point total of 223.4, 12.1 fewer points than this game’s over/under. Washington’s contests this season have a 231.7-point average over/under, 3.8 fewer points than this game’s point total.
The Pelicans score the 20th-most points in the league this season, while the Wizards’ offense puts up the 29th-most.
This outing features the NBA’s 16th-ranked (Wizards) and 25th-ranked (Pelicans) scoring defenses.

The Pelicans have entered the game as favorites eight times this season and won three of those games. The Wizards have been chosen as underdogs in 32 games this year and have walked away with the win six times (18.8%) in those games.

This season, New Orleans has won three of its four games when favored by at least -185 on the moneyline. This year, Washington has won five of 31 games when listed as at least +150 or better on the moneyline.
Bookmakers have implied with the moneyline set for this matchup that the Pelicans have a 64.9% chance to win.
